history.content: IMO with decent time management you should be fine taking EE16A with 70. Most people I know taking 70 are either taking it with a project class like 61B/C or another technical (Math 53, Math 54, EE 16A/B) and they are doing well. I think as long as you're diligent and able to keep up with the material (there's been lots of discussion in past threads on ways to do so!) then 70 will not take up an exorbitant amount of time per week.

I want to take 13 units in the fall so that I can dedicate my time to CS 70 and maximize my chances of getting into the CS major. I also want to take Punjabi 1A, which is 5 units, so I just need one more 4 unit class. Would taking EE16A take too much time away from CS 70? Or should I take a breadth and take EE16A and CS61C in the spring?

Also related: I've heard that 61C is a pre-req or useful class to take before/in conjunction with most upper-divs. Would you recommend taking 61C and a relatively easy upper-div CS class in the spring, or take EE16A and 61C and then start CS upper divs in summer or fall 2018? 

BTW, for anyone who's taken Cog Sci 1, how hard is it and how's the workload (I want to double in Cog Sci)? 

Thank you!
history.subject: Classes to Take In Fall With CS 70
